description: Updates an existing Amazon Lightsail bucket. Use this action to update the configuration of an existing bucket, such as versioning, public accessibility, and the Amazon Web Services accounts that can access the bucket.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket to update.

parameters.name: accessRules
parameters.description: An object that sets the public accessibility of objects in the specified bucket. getObject (string) --- Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket. The following options can be specified: public - Sets all objects in the bucket to public (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world. If the getObject value is set to public, then all objects in the bucket default to public regardless of the allowPublicOverrides value. private - Sets all objects in the bucket to private, making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to. If the getObject value is set to private, and the allowPublicOverrides value is set to true, then all objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured with a public-read ACL. Individual objects with a public-read ACL are readable by anyone in the world. allowPublicOverrides (boolean) --- A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are applied to individual objects override the getObject option that is currently specified. When this is true, you can use the PutObjectAcl Amazon S3 API action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the public-read ACL, or to private using the private ACL.

nested_params.name: getObject
nested_params.description: Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket. The following options can be specified:

nested_params.name: allowPublicOverrides
nested_params.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are applied to individual objects override the getObject option that is currently specified. When this is true, you can use the PutObjectAcl Amazon S3 API action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the public-read ACL, or to private using the private ACL.

parameters.name: versioning
parameters.description: Specifies whether to enable or suspend versioning of objects in the bucket. The following options can be specified: Enabled - Enables versioning of objects in the specified bucket. Suspended - Suspends versioning of objects in the specified bucket. Existing object versions are retained.

parameters.name: readonlyAccessAccounts
parameters.description: An array of strings to specify the Amazon Web Services account IDs that can access the bucket. You can give a maximum of 10 Amazon Web Services accounts access to a bucket. (string) ---

parameters.name: accessLogConfig
parameters.description: An object that describes the access log configuration for the bucket. A Boolean value that indicates whether bucket access logging is enabled for the bucket. destination (string) --- The name of the bucket where the access logs are saved. The destination can be a Lightsail bucket in the same account, and in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the source bucket. prefix (string) --- The optional object prefix for the bucket access log. The prefix is an optional addition to the object key that organizes your access log files in the destination bucket. For example, if you specify a logs/ prefix, then each log object will begin with the logs/ prefix in its key (for example, logs/2021-11-01-21-32-16-E568B2907131C0C0).

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether bucket access logging is enabled for the bucket.

nested_params.name: destination
nested_params.description: The name of the bucket where the access logs are saved. The destination can be a Lightsail bucket in the same account, and in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the source bucket.

nested_params.name: prefix
nested_params.description: The optional object prefix for the bucket access log. The prefix is an optional addition to the object key that organizes your access log files in the destination bucket. For example, if you specify a logs/ prefix, then each log object will begin with the logs/ prefix in its key (for example, logs/2021-11-01-21-32-16-E568B2907131C0C0).

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type of the bucket.

nested_items.name: accessRules
nested_items.description: An object that describes the access rules of the bucket.

nested_items.name: getObject
nested_items.description: Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.

public - Sets all objects in the bucket to public (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world. If the getObject value is set to public, then all objects in the bucket default to public regardless of the allowPublicOverrides value.

private - Sets all objects in the bucket to private, making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to. If the getObject value is set to private, and the allowPublicOverrides value is set to true, then all objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured with a public-read ACL. Individual objects with a public-read ACL are readable by anyone in the world.

nested_items.name: allowPublicOverrides
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are applied to individual objects override the getObject option that is currently specified.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.

nested_items.name: bundleId
nested_items.description: The ID of the bundle currently applied to the bucket.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the distribution was created.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL of the bucket.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the bucket.

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tag keys and optional values for the bucket. For more information, see Tags in Amazon Lightsail in the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: objectVersioning
nested_items.description: Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
Enabled - Object versioning is enabled.
Suspended - Object versioning was previously enabled but is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.
NeverEnabled - Object versioning has never been enabled.

nested_items.name: ableToUpdateBundle
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to a bucket can be changed to another bundle.

nested_items.name: readonlyAccessAccounts
nested_items.description: An array of strings that specify the Amazon Web Services account IDs that have read-only access to the bucket.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: resourcesReceivingAccess
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe Lightsail instances that have access to the bucket.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the Lightsail instance.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type (for example, Instance).

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The state code of the bucket.
OK - The bucket is in a running state.
Unknown - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out. You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: A message that describes the state of the bucket.

nested_items.name: accessLogConfig
nested_items.description: An object that describes the access log configuration for the bucket.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether bucket access logging is enabled for the bucket.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The name of the bucket where the access logs are saved. The destination can be a Lightsail bucket in the same account, and in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the source bucket.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: The optional object prefix for the bucket access log.

nested_items.name: operations
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources affected by the request.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the operation.

nested_items.name: resourceName
nested_items.description: The resource name.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The resource type.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the operation was initialized ( 1479816991.349).

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: isTerminal
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.

nested_items.name: operationDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the operation ( Debian-1GB-Ohio-1).

nested_items.name: operationType
nested_items.description: The type of operation.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the operation.

nested_items.name: statusChangedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the status was changed ( 1479816991.349).

nested_items.name: errorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: errorDetails
nested_items.description: The error details.
